From the question above, what is the total distance you have travelled while under this field?

Which\space of\space the\space following\space is\space the\space quadratic\space approximation\space of\space f(x,y)=\sin(x)\cos(y)\space about\space the\space point\space (\pi/3,\pi/6)? (Answer\space without\space computation).\\~\\

A.\space \frac{3}{4}+
\frac{\sqrt 3}{4}\left(x+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)+
\frac{-\sqrt 3}{4}\left(y+\frac{\pi}{6}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{-3}{4}\left(x+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)^2+
\frac{-1}{4}\left(x+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)\left(y+\frac{\pi}{6}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{3}{4}\left(y+\frac{\pi}{6}\right)^2\\~\\

B.\space \frac{3}{4}+
\frac{\sqrt 3}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)+
\frac{-\sqrt 3}{4}\left(y-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{-3}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)^2+
\frac{-1}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)\left(y-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{3}{4}\left(y-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)^2\\~\\

C.\space \frac{3}{4}+
\frac{\sqrt 3}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)+
\frac{-\sqrt 3}{4}\left(y-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{-3}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)^2+
\frac{-1}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)\left(y-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)+
\frac{1}{2}\times\frac{3}{4}\left(y-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)^2\\~\\

D.\space \frac{3}{4}+
\frac{\sqrt 3}{4}\left(x-\frac{\pi}{3}\right)+
\frac{-\sqrt 3}{4}\left(y-\frac{\pi}{6}\right)\\~\\


E.\space None of the above

Let\space f(x,y)\space be\space a\space multivariable\space function\space of\space variables\space x\space and\space y.\space Let\space H\space be\space its\space Hessian\space matrix\space at\space a\space critical\space point\space P.\space\\ What\space can\space then\space be\space said\space about the\space type\space of\space the\space critical\space point\space P\space of\space f\space from\space H?\\~\\


A. \space If\space H\space is\space positive\space definite,\space then\space P\space is\space a\space local\space minimum\space of\space f.\\~\\
B.\space If\space all\space the\space eigen\space values\space of\space H\space are\space positive,\space then\space P\space is\space a\space local\space minimum\space of\space f.\\~\\
C.\space If\space H\space is\space negative\space definite,\space P\space is\space a\space local\space maximum\space of\space f.\\~\\
D.\space If\space the\space second\space eigen\space value\space of\space H\space is\space 0,\space the\space test\space is\space indecisive.



Let f(x,y) be a multivariable function of variables x and y. Let H be its Hessian matrix at a critical point P. What can then be said aboutthe type of the critical point P of f from H? A. If H is positive definite, then P is a local minimum of f. B. If all the eigen values of H are positive, then P is a local minimum of f. C. If H is negative definite, P is a local maximum of f. D. If the second eigen value of H is 0, the test is indecisive.

Write the worst case time complexity for following pseudo code





def binarySearch(A[0..N-1], value) {


      low = 0


      high = N - 1


      while (low <= high) {


          mid = (low + high) / 2


          if (A[mid] > value)


              high = mid - 1


          else if (A[mid] < value)


              low = mid + 1


          else


              return mid


      }


      return not_found


  }

The function below correctly reverses a double linked list:


def reverse(dll):


	curr_node = dll


while(curr_node.next is not None):


	curr_node.prev, curr_node.next = curr_node.next, curr_node.prev


	curr_node = curr_node.next


return curr_node
